description.narrative:
The district Gwadar has approximately 700 Km long coastline where most of the population inhabitant along the coastal urban and semi-urban settlement name as Jiwani, Peshukan, Gwadar, Subrandar, Pani and Ormara and there is a very small proportion of rural settlements are remain scattered and live far-off from coastline i.e. union council of Suntsar and Kallag. The climate condition is semi-arid with low precipitation. The coastal area of district always facing small and high level of summer cyclone and winter south-western monsoon with having high stormed rain in frequent years. The urban settlements have not sufficient sewerage system or channels toescape rain water toward seashore or other reservoirs where the normal rains have shown hazard situation for population. The existing population always suffered for these situations and the socio-economic live will be disturbed. The local government or municipalauthorities have lacking the modern equipments and machineries and the skill human resources for risk management to facade the situations and overcome the suffering of commune. The coastline of Balochistan has also lies along the tectonic fault line which run from Iranian border towards Karachi coast having Tsunami history in 1935 and the gradual movement of carbon components deposit in mesosphere of earth are always shown by the arises of active mud volcanoes and islands emersion in recent past. The RCDC Gwader is the oldest organization of area, has long list of human resources to contribute their services for welfare and social uplift of existing community. They are involved in various socio-economic interventions to development interdependent society in Makran division. They have also an encouraging and acknowledging history for disaster and emergency response. RCDC has been providing humanitarian assistance to the affected communities since 1998. But due to untrained staff and volunteers our response has not been effective. Some of the organizational policies also need revisiting in order to meet the prevailing humanitarian principles.
The Disaster Project aim toEnhancing the ability of community volunteers to face natural disasters and the capacity building of Rural Community Development Council, Gwader as a humanitarian organization and training the staff and volunteers to provide rescue and relief services in case of an urgency. Because the RCDC Gwadar has core mediate to serve for the existing community for their social and economic strengthen. RCDC is also playing a hub role for connecting people without any discrimination and ensure facilitation with dignity and transparency even in emergency situations. But it need to organize and manage their interventions in a scientific and standardize manner. RCDC need to seek the internationally applied methodology for the humanitarian assistance and means of response in low and high level of disasters. This project should facilitate and capacitate the RCDC to manage or organize the disaster activities by standardized tools and techniques.

participating-org.narrative:
RCDC is registered under social welfare act 1971 whereas registration under societies Act 1860 is in process. It has head office inGwadar with 64 employees (60% women representation) for the reason that it works mainly on education and has network of schools. RCDC is one of the oldest local organizations of Gwadar which has a mandate of improving lives of local communities and it has rich experience in humanitarian response but with limited knowledge of SPHERE standards or HAP standards. RCDC followed CoC of PRCS in responding emergencies by providing services in health sector.
RCDC has experience in disaster risk reduction especially in coastal hazard mitigation and initiated many joint ventures with UNDP. It has long term standing and credibility in district Gwadar and has good coordination with all stakeholders including district government as they rely on its expertise during emergencies. RCDC needs technical backstopping in developing effective financial and M<(>&<)>E systems and can be a potential partner on coastal belt of Baluchistan. Therefore, recommended for humanitarian partnership. RCDC has outreach in all districts of Makran division of Baluchistan province.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security

description.narrative: no. of local organisations that have the capacity to provide quality humanitarian response according to international standards (sphere and code of conduct) when necessary and has improved its accountability towards the local people
